alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Coos and central Grafton Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stratford to 6 miles north of Canaan. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Plymouth, Hanover, Haverhill, Canaan, Franconia, Groton, Errol, Dixville, Woodstock, Stratford, Piermont, Carroll, Lyme, Lisbon and Jefferson. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 86 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
